desc: This course introduces you to SOAP Web Services using the JAX-WS standard specification. You will learn what SOAP web services are and how to write them. You will be writing a web service application, deploying, running and testing it on Glassfish. You will also learn to consume SOAP web services.
name: Developing SOAP Web Services with JAX-WS
objectives: Understanding the various components of a WSDL
Using JAX-WS annotations to write code that handles web service requests

1.unitDescription: This unit introduces you to web services. You'll learn some of the terminologies. You'll also build a simple client program that consumes an existing web service.

lessons.courseName: Developing SOAP Web Services with JAX-WS
lessons.description: Welcome to this tutorial course on SOAP web services in Java. We'll start with an introduction to web services. We'll understand what they are and how they are useful.
lessons.title: Introduction to Web Services

lessons.courseName: Developing SOAP Web Services with JAX-WS
lessons.description: Let us understand few of the most important concepts and terminologies used in web service technology.
lessons.title: Web Service Jargon

lessons.courseName: Developing SOAP Web Services with JAX-WS
lessons.description: In this video, we'll learn how to use the wsimport utility to create stubs that can be used to make web service calls.
lessons.title: Writing a Web service Client   Stub generation

lessons.courseName: Developing SOAP Web Services with JAX-WS
lessons.description: In this tutorial, we'll use the stubs generated by wsimport and implement a client application. Our IPServiceLocator program takes IP address as an input argument and makes a call to the web service to display the country name to the console.
lessons.title: Writing a Web service Client   Calling the Service

2.unitDescription: In this unit, you'll setup your development environment to build JAX-WS web services. You'll also write a web service and learn how to customize the WSDL, schema, write custom types, annotations and bind to XML using JAXB.

lessons.courseName: Developing SOAP Web Services with JAX-WS
lessons.description: In this tutorial, we'll walk through the steps to install the Java EE 7 SDK which includes the Glassfish 4 application server installation. We'll learn some basics of how to start, stop and manage Glassfish.
lessons.title: Setting up Java EE 7 SDK

lessons.courseName: Developing SOAP Web Services with JAX-WS
lessons.description: In this tutorial, we'll setup the new Eclipse Kepler, configure Glassfish and start writing the web application with which we intend to create a web service.
lessons.title: Writing a Web Service   Eclipse setup

lessons.courseName: Developing SOAP Web Services with JAX-WS
lessons.description: We'll now convert the simple Java class in the previous tutorial into a web service, deploy it to Glassfish, and test it by submitting a SOAP request to get a SOAP response.
lessons.title: Writing a Web Service   Code and Deploy

lessons.courseName: Developing SOAP Web Services with JAX-WS
lessons.description: We'll add an operation to our web service that takes input arguments to achieve both sending and receiving data from the web service.
lessons.title: Adding Input Arguments

lessons.courseName: Developing SOAP Web Services with JAX-WS
lessons.description: In this tutorial, we'll understand the two common methodologies for designing and writing web services - the service first (or code first) and the contract first (or WSDL first) approaches.
lessons.title: Service First and Contract First Web Services

lessons.courseName: Developing SOAP Web Services with JAX-WS
lessons.description: Now it's time to understand what's going on in the WSDL. We'll simplify our web service code to just one method, generate the WSDL for it and  understand the different elements that are generated.
lessons.title: Understanding the WSDL

lessons.courseName: Developing SOAP Web Services with JAX-WS
lessons.description: Having understood the important elements of the WSDL, we'll now learn some annotations that help us configure and override the various defaults that are used when the WSDL is generated.
lessons.title: Customizing the WSDL

lessons.courseName: Developing SOAP Web Services with JAX-WS
lessons.description: In this tutorial, we'll understand how types are handled in the WSDL. We'll also explore the two styles we can choose from for our WSDL - Document style and RPC style.
lessons.title: Schema Types and Binding Styles

lessons.courseName: Developing SOAP Web Services with JAX-WS
lessons.description: We'll make a couple of changes to the sample web service we've been developing all along. First, we will see what happens when a custom Java data type needs to be exchanged as a part of a web service operation. Then, we'll create a web service endpoint interface that our class implements.
lessons.title: Service Interface and Custom Types

lessons.courseName: Developing SOAP Web Services with JAX-WS
lessons.description: In this tutorial we'll understand how an XML binding framework like JAXB works to help convert our object instances to XML.
lessons.title: Using JAXB Annotations Part 1

lessons.courseName: Developing SOAP Web Services with JAX-WS
lessons.description: Let's now add some JAXB annotations to our Model class to customize the resulting XML.
lessons.title: Using JAXB Annotations Part 2

lessons.courseName: Developing SOAP Web Services with JAX-WS
lessons.description: Web services return 'Fault' messages to denote error scenarios. In this tutorial, we'll throw an exception, generate and examine a fault message.
lessons.title: Handling Faults

3.unitDescription: In this unit, you'll learn about some of the tools that let you work with SOAP web services. You'll also revisit the wsimport utility and learn what it does.

lessons.courseName: Developing SOAP Web Services with JAX-WS
lessons.description: This is a quick introduction to a web service testing tool called SoapUI. We use this tool to test our web service without having to use the Glassfish tester page. In this video, you'll learn how to install the SoapUI plugin in eclipse, create a new project and make a SOAP web service call from it.
lessons.title: Using SoapUI

lessons.courseName: Developing SOAP Web Services with JAX-WS
lessons.description: In this tutorial, you'll learn about the Web Service Explorer tool that come with Eclipse to test and examine web services.
lessons.title: Using Web Service Explorer

lessons.courseName: Developing SOAP Web Services with JAX-WS
lessons.description: There is an alternative way of publishing and running web services without having to use any app servers. In this tutorial, we'll use the Endpoint class to publish our web service.
lessons.title: Using Endpoint

lessons.courseName: Developing SOAP Web Services with JAX-WS
lessons.description: In this video, we will switch back to the client side and learn more about wsimport, the tool we used to generate client stubs.
lessons.title: wsimport Revisited
